title: Case Study-Based Reflective Practice Workshop for Strengthening Mathematics Instructional Design Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of elementary math curriculum and instructional design principles
context.additional_context: A program where pre-service teachers analyze judgment problems encountered when designing mathematics instruction in real classroom settings through case studies and develop professional expertise via reflective practice processes

learning_goals: Five or more design judgment issues arising from real elementary math lesson design cases can be identified and analyzed.
Visualize the instructional design decision-making process using a reflective practice framework (flowchart/diagram) and submit it
Evaluate the development of mathematical instructional design judgment ability in three stages through peer feedback and self-reflection journals

resources: Summary of Nelson & Stolterman’s Design Judgment Theory

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
